ground_truth: As she goes upstairs, the group of boys follows her. Walt goes over to Thao and sips his drink as Thao looks away. Walt matches off, leaving Thao looking dejected but thoughtful. Walt mows his front lawn with a push mower, and he looks up to see two of his Hmong neighbors bringing flowers to his house. The neighbors smile, and as they leave the flowers, Walt carries on mowing. He stops and looks back at them. Later, he opens his door to more neighbors bearing food, sniffs it, and waves the three women and their food inside, following them in. Later, he pulls onto his drive in his pickup and finds Sue, Thao, and their mother waiting for him; he shoos them away. He's on his porch drinking coffee and stands up as a sheepish-looking Thao approaches. Walt leaves him to it and wanders off towards his garage. Thao finds Walt watching his abatis border and looks thoughtful, then shrugs. Walt looks at a very dilapidated house across the street. Thao is up a ladder, fixing the old house, as Walt watches with a Hmong neighbor. Thao removes a louvered shutter from the roof, pulls up a dead tree in the garden, and loads rubble into a wheelbarrow. Walt, chewing tobacco, stands across the street with Daisy and watches as Thao fixes the house number onto a post on the porch. Walt smokes a cigarette and watches Thao scrape old paint off the clapboard exterior before giving it a coat of fresh paint. It's raining hard, and Walt stands on his porch watching Thao struggle with an old tree stump in the garden opposite as Walt smokes another cigarette. Thao digs the stump out in the rain, and exhausted, he sits down by the stump. An elder Hmong man and a young girl approach Walt as he sits on his front steps, and then they go. Smiling, Walt turns to Daisy, as a grinning Thao, rubbing his blistered hands together, walks up Walt's front steps. Walt is in his bathroom, spits blood into the sink, regards himself in the mirror for a moment, and then goes to the door as he considers. Thao's smile fades when he turns to go, but he turns back, and Walt's face softens a bit. Walt disappears inside and shuts the door, and Thao wanders down off the porch. Walt sits in a doctor's waiting room, glancing around at the other patients. An Indian woman sits beside him, and an Indian man and a black woman sit opposite him. A Muslim nurse appears wearing a headscarf, and Walt frowns. Irritated, Walt gets up as a female Oriental doctor checks his notes.

test_cases.name: Verbosity - L1
test_cases.description: As she ascends the staircase, a group of boys trails closely behind her, following her every step. Meanwhile, Walt approaches Thao and takes a sip from his drink, while Thao deliberately averts his gaze. Walt then strides away, leaving Thao behind, who appears both dejected and lost in thought. Walt proceeds to mow his front lawn using a push mower, and as he works, he glances up to notice two of his Hmong neighbors approaching his house with flowers in hand. The neighbors offer him warm smiles, and after they place the flowers down, Walt continues with his mowing. He pauses momentarily to look back at them as they depart. Later on, he opens his door to find more neighbors arriving, this time bearing food. He takes a moment to sniff the aroma and then gestures for the three women and their food to come inside, following them in. Subsequently, he pulls into his driveway in his pickup truck and discovers Sue, Thao, and their mother waiting for him; he dismisses them with a wave. Sitting on his porch, sipping coffee, he stands up as Thao approaches, looking somewhat sheepish. Walt leaves Thao to his own devices and meanders off towards his garage. Thao eventually finds Walt observing his abatis border, appearing pensive, then simply shrugs. Walt turns his attention to a very run-down house across the street. Thao is perched on a ladder, diligently working on the old house, while Walt watches alongside a Hmong neighbor. Thao removes a louvered shutter from the roof, uproots a dead tree in the garden, and loads debris into a wheelbarrow. Walt, chewing on tobacco, stands across the street with Daisy, observing as Thao affixes the house number onto a post on the porch. Walt lights a cigarette and watches Thao scrape away the old paint from the clapboard exterior before applying a fresh coat. As the rain pours down heavily, Walt stands on his porch, watching Thao struggle with an old tree stump in the garden opposite, all while smoking another cigarette. Thao manages to dig the stump out in the rain and, exhausted, sits down beside it. An elder Hmong man and a young girl approach Walt as he sits on his front steps, and after a brief interaction, they leave. Smiling, Walt turns to Daisy, as a grinning Thao, rubbing his blistered hands together, walks up Walt's front steps. Inside his bathroom, Walt spits blood into the sink, takes a moment to regard himself in the mirror, and then heads to the door, deep in thought. Thao's smile fades as he turns to leave, but he pauses and turns back, and Walt's expression softens slightly. Walt then disappears inside, shutting the door behind him, and Thao wanders down off the porch. Walt finds himself sitting in a doctor's waiting room, glancing around at the other patients. An Indian woman sits beside him, while an Indian man and a black woman sit across from him. A Muslim nurse, wearing a headscarf, appears, causing Walt to frown. Feeling irritated, Walt stands up as a female Oriental doctor reviews his notes.

test_cases.name: Verbosity - L2
test_cases.description: As she gracefully ascends the staircase, a group of boys trails closely behind her, following her every step with keen interest. Meanwhile, Walt approaches Thao casually and takes a sip from his drink, while Thao deliberately turns his gaze away, avoiding eye contact. Walt then strides away confidently, leaving Thao behind, who appears both dejected and lost in his own contemplative thoughts. Walt proceeds to mow his front lawn using a manual push mower, and as he diligently works, he glances up momentarily to notice two of his Hmong neighbors making their way toward his house, carrying flowers in their hands. The neighbors offer him warm, friendly smiles, and after they gently place the flowers down, Walt resumes his mowing. He pauses for a moment to look back at them as they depart. Later on, he opens his door to find more neighbors arriving, this time bringing delicious food. He takes a moment to inhale the enticing aroma and then gestures invitingly for the three women and their offerings to come inside, following them in with a welcoming nod. Subsequently, he pulls into his driveway in his sturdy pickup truck and discovers Sue, Thao, and their mother patiently waiting for him; he dismisses them with a nonchalant wave. Sitting comfortably on his porch, sipping his coffee, he stands up as Thao approaches, looking somewhat sheepish and unsure. Walt leaves Thao to his own devices and meanders off in a relaxed manner toward his garage. Thao eventually finds Walt observing his abatis border, where he appears deep in pensive thought, then simply shrugs. Walt turns his attention to a very run-down house across the street, focusing his gaze on it. Thao is perched on a ladder, efficiently working on the old house, while Walt watches intently alongside a Hmong neighbor. Thao carefully removes a louvered shutter from the roof, uproots a dead tree in the garden, and loads the debris into a wheelbarrow. Walt, chewing on tobacco, stands across the street with Daisy, observing as Thao skillfully affixes the house number onto a post on the porch. Walt lights a cigarette and watches closely as Thao scrapes away the old, peeling paint from the clapboard exterior before applying a fresh coat. As the rain pours down heavily, Walt stands on his porch, watching Thao struggle with an old tree stump in the garden opposite, all while smoking another cigarette. Thao manages to dig the stubborn stump out in the rain and, utterly exhausted, sits down beside it. An elder Hmong man and a young girl approach Walt as he sits on his front steps, and after a brief interaction with them, they leave. Smiling, Walt turns to Daisy, as a grinning Thao, rubbing his blistered hands together with a sense of accomplishment, walks up Walt's front steps. Inside his bathroom, Walt spits blood into the sink, takes a moment to regard himself thoughtfully in the mirror, and then heads to the door, lost deep in thought. Thao's smile fades as he turns to leave, but he pauses briefly and turns back, and Walt's expression softens slightly in response. Walt then disappears inside, shutting the door behind him, and Thao wanders down off the porch. Walt finds himself seated in a doctor's waiting room, discreetly glancing around at the other patients. An Indian woman sits beside him, while an Indian man and a black woman sit across from him. A Muslim nurse, wearing a headscarf, appears, causing Walt to frown with displeasure. Feeling irritated, Walt stands up as a female Oriental doctor reviews his notes attentively.

test_cases.name: Macro-Actions -> Micro-Actions
test_cases.description: As she ascends the staircase, each step echoing softly, the group of boys trails behind her, their footsteps a faint murmur in the background. Meanwhile, Walt approaches Thao, holding his drink with a casual grip, and takes a deliberate sip, his eyes momentarily meeting Thao's before Thao averts his gaze, seemingly lost in thought. Walt then turns away, his movements measured, leaving Thao standing there, a mix of dejection and contemplation etched on his face. Outside, Walt pushes his lawn mower across the grass, the rhythmic sound of the blades slicing through the lawn filling the air. He pauses, glancing up to notice two of his Hmong neighbors approaching with flowers in hand, their faces lit with friendly smiles. As they gently place the flowers at his doorstep, Walt acknowledges them with a nod and resumes mowing, though he can't help but stop and look back at them as they depart. Later, he opens his front door to find more neighbors arriving, this time bearing dishes of food. He inhales the aroma, nods approvingly, and gestures for the three women to come inside, following them into the house. Sometime after, Walt drives his pickup truck onto the driveway, only to be greeted by Sue, Thao, and their mother waiting expectantly. With a dismissive wave, he shoos them away, preferring solitude. Seated on his porch, sipping coffee, he rises as Thao approaches, looking somewhat embarrassed. Walt, choosing not to engage, leaves Thao to his own devices and ambles off towards his garage. Thao, left to ponder, eventually finds Walt observing his abatis border, a thoughtful expression on his face, before he shrugs off the moment. Walt's gaze shifts to a dilapidated house across the street, its state of disrepair evident. Thao, determined, climbs a ladder to repair the old house as Walt watches alongside a Hmong neighbor. Thao carefully removes a louvered shutter from the roof, then turns his attention to the garden, where he uproots a dead tree and loads debris into a wheelbarrow. Walt, chewing tobacco, stands across the street with Daisy, observing as Thao affixes the house number onto a post on the porch. Walt lights a cigarette, watching as Thao diligently scrapes away old paint from the clapboard exterior before applying a fresh coat. The rain begins to pour heavily, and Walt stands sheltered on his porch, cigarette in hand, as he watches Thao wrestle with an old tree stump in the garden opposite. Despite the downpour, Thao persists, eventually digging out the stump, and, exhausted, he collapses beside it. An elder Hmong man and a young girl approach Walt, who is seated on his front steps, and after a brief exchange, they leave. Walt, smiling, turns to Daisy, while Thao, grinning despite his blistered hands, makes his way up Walt's front steps. Inside his bathroom, Walt spits blood into the sink, his reflection staring back at him from the mirror. He pauses, contemplating, before heading to the door. Thao's smile fades as he turns to leave, but he hesitates, turning back to find Walt's expression softening slightly. Walt retreats inside, closing the door behind him, and Thao slowly descends the porch steps. Later, Walt finds himself in a doctor's waiting room, his eyes scanning the other patients. An Indian woman sits beside him, while an Indian man and a black woman occupy the seats opposite. A Muslim nurse, her headscarf neatly in place, enters, prompting Walt to frown. Feeling irritated, he rises from his seat as a female Oriental doctor reviews his notes, her attention momentarily diverted.

test_cases.name: Micro-Actions -> Macro-Actions
test_cases.description: As she ascends the stairs, a group of boys follows her. Walt approaches Thao, sips his drink, and then leaves, leaving Thao looking dejected but thoughtful. While mowing his lawn, Walt notices two Hmong neighbors bringing flowers to his house. They smile as they leave the flowers, and Walt continues mowing, pausing to look back at them. Later, he welcomes more neighbors bearing food, sniffing it before inviting them inside. Upon returning home in his pickup, he finds Sue, Thao, and their mother waiting and shoos them away. While drinking coffee on his porch, Walt stands as Thao approaches sheepishly, then wanders off toward his garage. Thao, working on a dilapidated house, catches Walt's attention as he watches with a Hmong neighbor. Thao removes a shutter, pulls up a dead tree, and loads rubble into a wheelbarrow, while Walt observes from across the street with Daisy. Walt watches Thao scrape and repaint the house's exterior. In the rain, Walt observes Thao struggle with an old tree stump, eventually sitting exhausted by it. An elder Hmong man and a young girl visit Walt on his front steps, and after they leave, Walt smiles at Daisy as Thao, rubbing his blistered hands, approaches. In his bathroom, Walt spits blood into the sink, contemplates his reflection, and then goes to the door. Thao's smile fades as he turns to leave, but he turns back, and Walt's expression softens. Walt then disappears inside, shutting the door, and Thao wanders off the porch. Walt sits in a doctor's waiting room, observing the diverse patients around him. A Muslim nurse appears, and Walt frowns, getting up as a female Oriental doctor reviews his notes.

test_cases.name: Insert Attributes, Emotions and Scene
test_cases.description: As she goes upstairs in their modest suburban home on the edge of the city, the group of boys follows her, their laughter echoing in the narrow hallway. Walt, a Korean War veteran who had lived in the neighborhood for decades, goes over to Thao and sips his drink as Thao looks away, feeling the weight of unspoken conversations. Walt matches off, leaving Thao looking dejected but thoughtful. Walt mows his front lawn with a vintage push mower, a relic from a bygone era, and he looks up to see two of his Hmong neighbors, part of a vibrant community that had settled in the area during the late 20th century, bringing flowers to his house. The neighbors smile, a customary gesture of goodwill, and as they leave the flowers, Walt carries on mowing. He stops and looks back at them, his expression softening. Later, he opens his door to more neighbors bearing food, an assortment of traditional Hmong dishes, sniffs it, and waves the three women and their food inside, following them in. Later, he pulls onto his drive in his aging pickup, emblematic of his practical nature, and finds Sue, Thao, and their mother waiting for him; he shoos them away, gruffly maintaining his solitary demeanor. He's on his porch drinking coffee and stands up as a sheepish-looking Thao approaches, mustering the courage for an apology. Walt leaves him to it and wanders off towards his garage, a sanctuary filled with tools and memories. Thao finds Walt watching his abatis border, a defensive structure he had constructed with military precision, and looks thoughtful, then shrugs. Walt looks at a very dilapidated house across the street, a reminder of the neighborhood's gradual decline. Thao is up a ladder, fixing the old house, as Walt watches with a Hmong neighbor, who shares stories of resilience and adaptation. Thao removes a louvered shutter from the roof, pulls up a dead tree in the garden, and loads rubble into a wheelbarrow, determined to restore the house. Walt, chewing tobacco, stands across the street with Daisy, his faithful Labrador, and watches as Thao fixes the house number onto a post on the porch. Walt smokes a cigarette and watches Thao scrape old paint off the clapboard exterior before giving it a coat of fresh paint, reminiscent of the original 1940s architecture. It's raining hard, the downpour persistent, and Walt stands on his porch watching Thao struggle with an old tree stump in the garden opposite as Walt smokes another cigarette. Thao digs the stump out in the rain, and exhausted, he sits down by the stump. An elder Hmong man and a young girl approach Walt as he sits on his front steps, offering a small token of appreciation, and then they go. Smiling, Walt turns to Daisy, as a grinning Thao, rubbing his blistered hands together, walks up Walt's front steps, showing his determination to earn Walt's respect. Walt is in his bathroom, spits blood into the sink, an ominous sign of his deteriorating health, regards himself in the mirror for a moment, and then goes to the door as he considers his next steps. Thao's smile fades when he turns to go, but he turns back, and Walt's face softens a bit, a rare moment of shared understanding. Walt disappears inside and shuts the door, and Thao wanders down off the porch, feeling the weight of their unspoken connection. Walt sits in a doctor's waiting room, glancing around at the other patients, a vivid representation of the community's diversity. An Indian woman sits beside him, and an Indian man and a black woman sit opposite him, all seeking medical care in a shared space. A Muslim nurse appears wearing a headscarf, a symbol of her faith, and Walt frowns, unaccustomed to such diversity. Irritated, Walt gets up as a female Oriental doctor, reflecting the region's broad ethnic makeup, checks his notes.

In the neonlit back alleys of a dystopian metropolis a rogue hacker races against time while being chased by relentless cyborg enforcers their footsteps echoing off rainsoaked pavement. Under the relentless desert sun a lone gunslinger confronts a notorious outlaw at a deserted crossroads both men exchanging steely glances as swirling dust blurs the horizon. On a foggy evening in Victorian London an intrepid detective uncovers a hidden conspiracy among the city’s elite with gaslit streets setting the stage for a race against a mounting darkness. High above a sprawling city skyline a daredevil pilot executes deathdefying maneuvers in a vintage biplane narrowly evading enemy fire as the ground morphs into a dizzying mosaic below. Within the creaking walls of an old countryside manor an estranged family gathers for a mysterious inheritance their hushed whispers and secret glances weaving a tapestry of betrayal and suspense. Amidst the roaring tempest of a stormy ocean a weathered sailor battles nature’s fury on a creaking vessel his resolve as steadfast as the crashing waves that threaten to engulf him. On a bustling 1960s New York street a passionate artist finds unexpected inspiration in the chaotic interplay of urban life capturing moments of love loss and defiant hope on a rainsoaked canvas. Deep in the heart of an enchanted forest a brave knight embarks on a perilous quest to rescue a captive princess facing mythical creatures and treacherous traps with unwavering courage. During a heated political rally in a futuristic city a charismatic leader stokes both hope and dissent. as holographic banners illuminate the night sky and fervent crowds surge with anticipation. In the eerie silence of a postapocalyptic wasteland a hardened survivor scavenges through abandoned ruins haunted by the echoes of a oncethriving civilization now reduced to dust. Beneath the shimmering surface of an underwater kingdom a rebellious mermaid defies ancient traditions to explore forbidden coral reefs and secret caverns brimming with forgotten lore. In the quiet confines of a suburban attic an unassuming teenager stumbles upon a mysterious portal that thrusts him into a surreal world where the very fabric of time and space unravels. Walt turns to Daisy as a grinning. Thao rubbing his blistered hands together walks up Walt's front steps. Thao's smile fades when he turns to go but he turns back and Walt's face softens a bit. Walt disappears inside and shuts the door and Thao wanders down off the porch. A Muslim nurse appears wearing a headscarf and Walt frowns. Irritated. Walt gets up as a female Oriental doctor checks his notes.

Grinning, the lamp turns to Ruby, as a beaming book, rubbing its blistered paws together, skips up the lamp's back stairs. Aardvark trims his side lawn with a tricycle, and he peers up to notice two of his Inuit neighbors delivering seashells to his house. The neighbors wave, and as they leave the seashells, Aardvark continues trimming. He pauses and gazes back at them. Later, he closes his gate to more neighbors bearing textiles, sniffs them, and beckons the trio of women and their textiles inside, trailing them in. test_cases.name: Complete Corruption
test_cases.description: The film starts with a man waking up in a small apartment. He prepares coffee and checks his phone for messages. There are none, so he heads out to catch a bus. On the way, he passes a neighbor who greets him briefly. At the bus stop, he notices a group of students talking about an upcoming test. He boards the bus and sits near the back, watching the city pass by outside the window. After a few stops, he gets off near a large office building. He enters the lobby and goes through security. He rides an elevator to the tenth floor, where he works as an assistant. His manager asks him to prepare some documents for a meeting later in the day. He collects files from different departments and organizes them in a conference room. Another employee asks him for help with a software issue, so he takes a few minutes to fix it. Then he returns to the conference room to double-check everything before the meeting begins. The meeting starts at noon. Several people join via video call, and others sit around the table. The manager outlines the project goals, and each team member shares updates on their tasks. There are questions about deadlines and budgets, but no big surprises. After an hour, they end the call. The manager thanks everyone and leaves. The assistant cleans up the room, collects leftover notes, and heads back to his desk. During lunch, he walks to a nearby café, where he orders a simple meal. He eats alone and checks social media on his phone. After lunch, he returns to the office and finishes smaller tasks, such as sending emails and filing paperwork. He also helps a coworker carry boxes of supplies to another floor. Later in the afternoon, the manager calls him in to discuss next week's schedule. They go over a few changes, and the assistant updates the calendar. When the workday ends, he logs off his computer and leaves the building. Outside, he walks a few blocks to meet a friend. They chat about weekend plans and decide to see a film on Saturday. The assistant then heads home on a crowded bus. At his apartment, he sorts his mail, feeds a pet cat, and warms up leftovers for dinner. He watches a short news segment on TV, then checks his phone again. A message from his friend confirms their plan for the weekend. He feels relieved to have something to look forward to. The film ends with him preparing for bed, setting an alarm, and turning off the lights. He reflects briefly on the day, thinking about his tasks, his quiet home, and the plans ahead.

test_cases.name: Summarization
test_cases.description: Upstairs, a group of boys follows a girl. Walt drinks with Thao, who looks away, feeling dejected. Later, Walt mows his lawn while Hmong neighbors bring flowers and food to his home, which he accepts. Walt returns to find Sue, Thao, and their mother waiting; he dismisses them. Thao approaches sheepishly while Walt stands on his porch, then wanders off. Thao works on a dilapidated house, watched by Walt and a Hmong neighbor. Despite rain, Thao removes stumps and paints, impressing Walt. An elder Hmong man visits Walt, who smiles at Thao's blisters. Walt spits blood in his bathroom, softening when Thao approaches. Thao leaves, and Walt later sits irritated in a doctor's waiting room, surrounded by diverse patients.
